name: (R) ENERGY STAR Windows
_description: Typical size residential double pane window that meets the ENERGY STAR version 7 performance specification

notes: assumes 'Northern' maps to AIA climate zones 1 and 2, 'North:Central' maps to AIA climate zone 3, 'South:Central' maps to AIA climate zone 4, and 'Southern' maps to AIA climate zone 5.

source_data.title: ENERGY STAR Product Specification Residential Windows, Doors, and Skylights Version 7.0
source_data.author: ENERGY STAR

installed_cost_source.notes: Assume baseline window cost from Scout data

source_data.title: Scout Baseline Envelope Characteristics Database
source_data.author: U.S. Department of Energy, Office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy, Building Technologies Office

product_lifetime_source.notes: Average lifetime for Low:E, Triple, Non:metal, Arg, L:Gain

source_data.title: NREL National Residential Efficiency Measures Database
source_data.author: National Renewable Energy Laboratory
